p:
On the other extreme, a study on
Armadillidium vulgare
proved that critical thermal maximum decline interrelated with declining oxygen concentration ( Klok et al. 2004). A developed ‘tracheal’ system in certain terrestrial isopods, such as in
A. vulgare
( Csonka et al. 2013) makes oxygen delivery more efficient. Hypoxia causes a considerable effect decreasing metabolic rate and upper thermal tolerance, compared to insects.
